name: SpecProc
short_description:
At last, the mighty SpecProc is available to all.
This is version 1.11 revC featuring all I could squeeze out of it.

This includes tof and quad data, spectrum and chromatogram extraction.

Note that methods (olp) files created with earlier versions will throw an error when you try an import them. But hey, a small price to pay. They can only ever have a few things in them anyway.


SpecProc is a general processing tool for MassLynx data. With you can query spectra and ask questions about the data’s intensity, resolution and mass difference. To some of the queries you can attach pass/fail criteria. 

SpecProc’s results can be viewed in a Internet Explorer for easy reading and printing. 

Written in VB6 many many years ago it still works just fine on the latest Masslynx versions.
All the interaction is through the MassLynx DACServer dll. If this is working then SpecProc is working.

The one thing it can't do is different mass lists per peak. Shame.
summary: SpecProc is a general processing tool for MassLynx data.

audience.fullpath: Intended Audience :: by Industry or Sector :: Science/Research
